alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 19 at 1:38AM MDT until August 20 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Sunday... .Prolonged period of hot and dry conditions have led to the drying out of fuels across the watch area. Gusty southerly winds will develop during the afternoon hours, this combined with low relative humidity values and hot temperatures will lead to the potential for rapid wildfire spread.. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 252,253,and 254. The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. * WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 14 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid to upper 90s. * IMPACTS... Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
